intro: Trichosacme lanata, commonly known as the hairy trichosacme, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to dry conditions. Its small, clustered flowers are usually greenish-white in color. Trichosacme lanata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is valued for its resilience in harsh climates.
